commitResults.messageTitle: Level 1. Greet, Echo, Exit Implement a skeletal version of Duke that starts by greeting the user, simply echos commands entered by the user, and exits when the user types bye.

commitResults.messageBody: Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 3. Mark as Done Add the ability to mark tasks as done. A-Classes Use a class to represent tasks

Level 4. ToDos, Events, Deadlines Add support for tracking three types of tasks:     ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it e.g., visit new theme park     Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time e.g., submit report by 11/10/2019 5pm     Events: tasks that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time e.g., team project meeting on 2/10/2019 2-4pm A-Inheritance Use Inheritance to support multiple task types
A-TextUiTesting Test using the I/O redirection technique
Level 5. Handle Errors Teach Duke to deal with errors such as incorrect inputs entered by the user. A-Exceptions Use Exceptions to handle errors
Level 6. Delete Add support for deleting tasks from the list. A-Collections Use Java Collections classes
Reworked the system to be more OO, Added task, exception and command package Added commands: to handle duke's replies Added parser class to handle parsing
